33  package edu.emory.mathcs.jtransforms.fft;
34  
35  import org.junit.Assert;
36  
37  /**
38   * A utility class for consistently asserting equality of two floating-point
39   * numbers.
40   *
41   * @author S&eacute;bastien Brisard
42   *
43   */
44  public class FloatingPointEqualityChecker {
45  	/**
46  	 * If the expected (<code>double</code>) value is below this threshold, the
47  	 * relative error is not tested.
48  	 */
49  	private final double dabs;
50  
51  	/** Maximum (<code>double</code> relative error. */
52  	private final double drel;
53  
54  	/**
55  	 * If the expected (<code>double</code>) value is below this threshold, the
56  	 * relative error is not tested.
57  	 */
58  	private final float fabs;
59  
60  	/** Maximum (<code>float</code> relative error. */
61  	private final double frel;
62  
63  	/** Default message used in all thrown exceptions. */
64  	private final String msg;
65  
66  	/**
67  	 * Creates a new instance of this class.
68  	 *
69  	 * @param msg
70  	 *            the default message returned by all assertion exceptions
71  	 * @param drel
72  	 *            the maximum relative error, for <code>double</code> values
73  	 * @param dabs
74  	 *            the maximum absolute error, for <code>double</code> values
75  	 * @param frel
76  	 *            the maximum relative error, for <code>float</code> values
77  	 * @param fabs
78  	 *            the maximum absolute error, for <code>float</code> values
79  	 */
80  	public FloatingPointEqualityChecker(final String msg, final double drel,
81  			final double dabs, final float frel, final float fabs)
82  	{
83  		this.msg = msg;
84  		this.drel = drel;
85  		this.dabs = dabs;
86  		this.frel = frel;
87  		this.fabs = fabs;
88  	}
89  
90  	/**
91  	 * Asserts that two <code>double</code>s are equal.
92  	 *
93  	 * @param msg
94  	 *            a message to be concatenated with the default message
95  	 * @param expected
96  	 *            expected value
97  	 * @param actual
98  	 *            the value to check against <code>expected</code>
99  	 */
100 	public final void assertEquals(final String msg, final double expected,
101 			final double actual)
102 	{
103 		final double delta = Math.abs(actual - expected);
104 		if (!(delta <= drel * Math.abs(expected))) {
105 			Assert.assertEquals(this.msg + msg + ", abs = " + delta
106 					+ ", rel = " + (delta / Math.abs(expected)), expected,
107 					actual, dabs);
108 		}
109 	}
110 
111 	/**
112 	 * Asserts that two <code>float</code>s are equal.
113 	 *
114 	 * @param msg
115 	 *            a message to be concatenated with the default message
116 	 * @param expected
117 	 *            expected value
118 	 * @param actual
119 	 *            the value to check against <code>expected</code>
120 	 */
121 	public final void assertEquals(final String msg, final float expected,
122 			final float actual)
123 	{
124 		final float delta = Math.abs(actual - expected);
125 		if (!(delta <= frel * Math.abs(expected))) {
126 			Assert.assertEquals(this.msg + msg + ", abs = " + delta
127 					+ ", rel = " + (delta / Math.abs(expected)), expected,
128 					actual, fabs);
129 		}
130 	}
131 }
